original: re zhig 'bras bu'i nges pa mthong ba las nges par byed pa ma mthong ba la sogs pa go ba yin zhes gang smras pa de ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bu'i nges pa mthong ba las nges par byed pa ma mthong ba la sogs pa go ba yin zhes gang smras pa de ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable to say that the certainty of the effect is seen first, and then the certainty of the cause is seen.

original: bsnyems pa de bor nas sems pa can gyi bye brag sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de la 'di spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: bsnyems pa de bor nas sems pa can gyi bye brag sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de la 'di spyad par bya ste /
translated: But when you abandon that conceit, then whatever you establish as the specific nature of the mind, that is what you should practice.

original: re zhig sa gzhi la sogs pa 'u bu cag la sogs pa'i longs spyad par bya ba la sogs pa bzhin du las kyi nye bar bsgrubs pa yin par go ba yin no //🔽las kyang gnas la sogs pa don du gnyer ba'i snying po can nam /
analyzed: re zhig sa gzhi la sogs pa 'u bu cag la sogs pa'i longs spyad par bya ba la sogs pa bzhin du las kyi nye bar bsgrubs pa yin par go ba yin no // las kyang gnas la sogs pa don du gnyer ba'i snying po can nam /
translated: You understand that the earth, etc. are the effects of the karma of ourselves and others, etc.🔽And karma is the essence of the desire for a place, etc.

original: byed pa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba'i snying po can te /
analyzed: byed pa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba'i snying po can te /
translated: Or it is the essence of the desire for an agent, etc.

original: bdag lha'am klur gyur cig ces bya ba'i sems nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag lha'am klur gyur cig ces bya ba'i sems nyid yin no //
translated: The mind itself is the desire to be a god or a nāga.

original: des na 'bras bu dang rgyu dang de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thams cad du lhag par zhen pa rnams bag chags kyi sgo nas gnas pa ni byin gyis rlob pa por rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu dang rgyu dang de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thams cad du lhag par zhen pa rnams bag chags kyi sgo nas gnas pa ni byin gyis rlob pa por rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who are attached to the existence of effects, causes, and so on, are possessed by the power of habitual tendencies, and they imagine that there is an experiencer.

original: 'dis ni bsod nams kyi blo'i nus pa bshad pa yin no //🔽gal te yang rnam pa thams cad ma mthong ba de lta na yang de sna tshogs pa /
analyzed: 'dis ni bsod nams kyi blo'i nus pa bshad pa yin no // gal te yang rnam pa thams cad ma mthong ba de lta na yang de sna tshogs pa /
translated: This explains the power of the mind of merit.🔽Even though one does not see all aspects, still, it is said that the variety is known.

original: rig pa yin zhes thams cad shes par yongs su shes pa bzhin du thams cad du lhag par zhen pa can gyi so sor snang ba'i byin gyis slob po por nas de la gzhan du rtogs pa la ni tshad ma cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: rig pa yin zhes thams cad shes par yongs su shes pa bzhin du thams cad du lhag par zhen pa can gyi so sor snang ba'i byin gyis slob po por nas de la gzhan du rtogs pa la ni tshad ma cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Just as one knows all by knowing one, the experiencer is possessed by the power of the appearance of each particular thing. There is not the slightest valid cognition of anything else.

original: de ltar na byed pa med pa'i blo rtogs bya ma yin pa rtag pa ni rang bzhin nyid kyis byin gyis rlob pa po nyid yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma mthong ba du ma'i rtogs pas yongs su du ba yang bsal ba yin no zhes dgongs
analyzed: de ltar na byed pa med pa'i blo rtogs bya ma yin pa rtag pa ni rang bzhin nyid kyis byin gyis rlob pa po nyid yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma mthong ba du ma'i rtogs pas yongs su du ba yang bsal ba yin no zhes dgongs
translated: Thus, the non-existent, permanent, non-operational cognition, which is not to be realized, is the self-empowerer, etc.  This is the meaning of the passage.

original: pa'o // nges pa can tsam sgrub pa yin na grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa'o // nges pa can tsam sgrub pa yin na grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it is a mere affirmation of the definite, then it is an affirmation of what is already established.

original: sems pa can gyi bye brag grub pa yin na mnyan bya nyid bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa srid pas lhag pa dang ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems pa can gyi bye brag grub pa yin na mnyan bya nyid bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa srid pas lhag pa dang ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is an affirmation of the particular of the sentient, then, like the object of hearing, it is without concomitance, and so there is the possibility of error.  This is the meaning of the statement, “it would be redundant.”

original: sems pa can ma yin pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i byed pa po rnams ni bya ba brtsams par byed pa por cis mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa can ma yin pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i byed pa po rnams ni bya ba brtsams par byed pa por cis mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the non-sentient are empowered, why are they not agents that commence activity?

original: mig la sogs pa dang me la sogs pa rnams @139b ni ji rnyed pa tshogs pa yin na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang me la sogs pa rnams @139b ni ji rnyed pa tshogs pa yin na /
translated: If the eye, etc., and fire, etc., are collections of the obtained,

original: rnam shes dang du ba la sogs pa'i bya ba brtsams pa yang rtsom par byed pa kho na yin la sa gzhi la sogs pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i bya ba la ni brtsam pa byas pa yang /
analyzed: rnam shes dang du ba la sogs pa'i bya ba brtsams pa yang rtsom par byed pa kho na yin la sa gzhi la sogs pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i bya ba la ni brtsam pa byas pa yang /
translated: The action of consciousness and smoke and so on is initiated only by the agent, but the action of the ground and so on and cloth and so on is not initiated by the agent.

original: snal ma dang rdul phra rab la sogs pa rnams kyis rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snal ma dang rdul phra rab la sogs pa rnams kyis rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The action of thread and subtle particles and so on is not initiated by the agent.

original: ma mthong pa la sogs pa nges pa can gyi lhan cig byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po rnams kyi nus pa ni 'bras bu la rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma mthong pa la sogs pa nges pa can gyi lhan cig byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po rnams kyi nus pa ni 'bras bu la rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the definite nonobservation of a coexistent cause does not exist and because the capacity of agents is to be understood in terms of their effect.

original: ci'i phyir 'jug pa ldog pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jug pa ldog pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of arguing and investigating why the engagement of the cause is stopped?

original: du ba la sogs pa rnams ni gtan tshigs yin gyi /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa rnams ni gtan tshigs yin gyi /
translated: Smoke and so on are the reason.

original: de dag ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de dag ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that they are not is taught.

original: gang gi phyir de dag yod kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag yod kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because they exist,

original: 'dod pa ni grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: the desire is established.

original: rtsod pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ji ltar chos can bye brag du byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ji ltar chos can bye brag du byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Because it is a matter of dispute, just as the subject is specified,

original: nye bar dmigs pa dang ldan pa chos nyid dang bye brag du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa dang ldan pa chos nyid dang bye brag du bya ba yin no //
translated: so too is the object of apprehension specified as a real entity.

original: gzhan du na grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du na grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Otherwise, it would be a case of proving what is already established.

original: gang la rtsod pa yod pa de zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gang la rtsod pa yod pa de zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is what is shown by the words, “That which is the matter of dispute. . . . ”

original: dbang phyug la skul byed yin pa ni 'di'i 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes kun tu rtog pa yin la /🔽chos la sogs pa'i bye brag nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug la skul byed yin pa ni 'di'i 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes kun tu rtog pa yin la / chos la sogs pa'i bye brag nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: The idea is that it is the instigator of God that is established,

original: dbyig pa la sogs pa bzhin du sems pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyig pa la sogs pa bzhin du sems pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: not the real entity itself, because it is not an entity that thinks, like a stick, etc.

original: des nye bar dmigs pa can gyis rgyu nyid du dam bcas pa nyid kyis sems pa can ma yin pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des nye bar dmigs pa can gyis rgyu nyid du dam bcas pa nyid kyis sems pa can ma yin pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: The fact that it is the object of apprehension rules out the possibility that it is not an entity that thinks.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub bya grub pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub bya grub pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the probandum is not established.

original: las las skyed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: las las skyed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The idea is that it is the cause of karma.

original: bsgrub bya ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not the case that it is not the object of attainment.🔽If you accept karma, then by that very fact you accept that it is the mere thought of dharma, and so the conception is light. But if you accept that God is the creator of all things, then the conception of him is heavy.🔽To show this, he says, “If there is karma that has the nature of a conscious being . . . ”

original: las khas len pa yin na de nyid kyis chos sems pa can tsam du khas len pa yin pas rtog pa yang bar du 'gyur ba yin la dbang phyug la ni de dang chos can gyi rtog pa yang zhes bya ba yin pas lci la yin par bstan
analyzed: las khas len pa yin na de nyid kyis chos sems pa can tsam du khas len pa yin pas rtog pa yang bar du 'gyur ba yin la dbang phyug la ni de dang chos can gyi rtog pa yang zhes bya ba yin pas lci la yin par bstan
translated: You might think that the only difference between a conscious being and the other, between an agent and a nonagent, is that the former is said to be karma and the latter is said to be the agent, and that they are not distinguished by anything else.

original: pa ni / gal te sems pa can gyi rang bzhin gyi las yod na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: pa ni / gal te sems pa can gyi rang bzhin gyi las yod na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: To this he says, “Those that are unconscious . . . ”🔽You might think that the only difference between a conscious being and the other, between an agent and a nonagent, is that the former is said to be karma and the latter is said to be the agent, and that they are not distinguished by anything else.🔽To this he says, “Those that are unconscious . . . ”🔽You might think that the only difference between a conscious being and the other, between an agent and a nonagent, is that the former is said to be karma and the latter is said to be the agent, and that they are not distinguished by anything else.🔽To this he says, “Those that are unconscious . . . ”

original: de nyid 'di yin pa ni sems pa can dang / cig shos dang / byed pa po dang byed pa po zhes bya ba gnyis po khyed kyi las yin par bshad pa dang / bdag gi byad pa po yin zhes bya ba ming tsam gyis phye ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin pa ni sems pa can dang / cig shos dang / byed pa po dang byed pa po zhes bya ba gnyis po khyed kyi las yin par bshad pa dang / bdag gi byad pa po yin zhes bya ba ming tsam gyis phye ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
translated: You might think that the only difference between a conscious being and the other, between an agent and a nonagent, is that the former is said to be karma and the latter is said to be the agent, and that they are not distinguished by anything else.🔽To this he says, “Those that are unconscious . . . ”🔽You might think that the only difference between a conscious being and the other, between an agent and a nonagent, is that the former is said to be karma and the latter is said to be the agent, and that they are not distinguished by anything else.

original: de la sems pa med pa rnams zhes bya ba smos so //🔽gang @140a * //
analyzed: de la sems pa med pa rnams zhes bya ba smos so // gang @140a * //
translated: To this he says, “Those that are unconscious . . . ”

original: gi phyir ming tsam gyis tha dad par khyed ji ltar 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: gi phyir ming tsam gyis tha dad par khyed ji ltar 'dod pa yin /
translated: You might think that the only difference between a conscious being and the other, between an agent and a nonagent, is that the former is said to be karma and the latter is said to be the agent, and that they are not distinguished by anything else.🔽To this he says, “Those that are unconscious . . . ”🔽You might think that the only difference between a conscious being and the other

original: khyed kyis kyang las ni khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: khyed kyis kyang las ni khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: You also accept karma.

original: de yang la /
analyzed: de yang la /
translated: And that is

original: de la yang sems pa can du lhag par kho bos brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: de la yang sems pa can du lhag par kho bos brjod pa yin la /
translated: also mental. I have stated that it is mental.

original: des na tha dad pa'i dbang phyug dgag pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des na tha dad pa'i dbang phyug dgag pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the refutation of a separate Īśvara is presented:

original: las kyi rang bzhin sems pa nyid //
analyzed: las kyi rang bzhin sems pa nyid //
translated: The nature of karma is mental.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is stated.

original: bshad pa'i rigs pas las kyis bskul ba byin gyis brlabs par grub pa yin na /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rigs pas las kyis bskul ba byin gyis brlabs par grub pa yin na /
translated: The reasoning explained establishes that the mental is empowered by karma.

original: sems pa can gzhan lhag pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: sems pa can gzhan lhag pa kho na yin te /
translated: Another mental is a remainder.

original: de'i bya ba lhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bya ba lhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no remainder of its activity.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i lhag ma lta bu yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i lhag ma lta bu yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: It is like the remainder of a potter, etc., with respect to a pot, etc.

original: 'dod pa grub pa nyid la gtan tshigs sam dpe la ma grub pa yin zhes sbyor bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa grub pa nyid la gtan tshigs sam dpe la ma grub pa yin zhes sbyor bar byed pa ni /
translated: If one applies the argument that the example is not established to the establishment of the thesis,

original: de lta na yang dpe ma grub ces bya ba ni sems pa can la yang sems pa can gzhan du rtog pa yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang dpe ma grub ces bya ba ni sems pa can la yang sems pa can gzhan du rtog pa yin na'o //
translated: then the statement “The example is not established” is a conception of another mental with respect to the mental.

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa la yang rang gi bya ba'i yul shes pa yin pas thams cad shes pa las bye brag med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa la yang rang gi bya ba'i yul shes pa yin pas thams cad shes pa las bye brag med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even potters and so on are aware of the objects of their actions, so there is no difference between them and omniscience.

original: byis pa nyis kyi gnas skabs las bye brag yin par smra ba ni /
analyzed: byis pa nyis kyi gnas skabs las bye brag yin par smra ba ni /
translated: The assertion that the difference is in terms of the state of the childish is as follows:

original: 'on te rdza mkhan la sogs pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te rdza mkhan la sogs pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “But that potter and so on” and so forth.

original: de'i tshe yang rgan po rnams las de'i sgrub pa mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang rgan po rnams las de'i sgrub pa mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Even then, because the elderly see the establishment of that,

original: dbang phyug gi gnas skabs med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbang phyug gi gnas skabs med par bstan pa ni /
translated: the absence of the state of Īśvara is taught:

original: byed po grub na kun shes nyid //
analyzed: byed po grub na kun shes nyid //
translated: “If the creator were established, he would be omniscient.”

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated.

original: mthong ba'i yul la skye ba po rang nyid dbang byad pa yin par ni bden na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul la skye ba po rang nyid dbang byad pa yin par ni bden na /
translated: It is true that in the seen domain, the one who is born himself has power,

original: ma mthong ba la ji ltar yin /
analyzed: ma mthong ba la ji ltar yin /
translated: but how is it in the unseen?

original: rgan po rnams kyang de la dbang med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rgan po rnams kyang de la dbang med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Even the elderly are powerless over that,

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: because it is beyond the senses.

original: gal te de thams cad shes pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te de thams cad shes pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thinking this, it is said, “If he were omniscient,” and so on.

original: da ltar ba bzhin du dpyod pa med pa'i bya ba mthong ba las phyin ci log par go ba ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ba bzhin du dpyod pa med pa'i bya ba mthong ba las phyin ci log par go ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the activity is understood in a distorted way, as if it were not an analysis like the present one.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: dpyod pa med pa'i 'bras bu ni dpyod pa dang 'gal ba yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa'i 'bras bu ni dpyod pa dang 'gal ba yin par mi rigs te /
translated: The result of an activity that is not an analysis is not suitable as being in contradiction with an analysis,

original: gdams ngag dam pa dang 'tsham pa'i 'bras bu sbyin pa dag gi rnam par dpyod pa'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gdams ngag dam pa dang 'tsham pa'i 'bras bu sbyin pa dag gi rnam par dpyod pa'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: because it is an activity that analyzes the bestowal of a result that is in accordance with the highest instruction.

original: 'on te / don dam pa nyid kyi nye bar bstan pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te / don dam pa nyid kyi nye bar bstan pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what he thinks.

original: lan du dpyod pa med pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir dpyod pa med pa'i bya ba nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lan du dpyod pa med pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir dpyod pa med pa'i bya ba nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The response is that the activity of one who is not an analysis is taught to be an activity that is not an analysis.

original: 'di ni chos min pa la'ang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni chos min pa la'ang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is stated in the line “This is also the case for non-Dharma.”

original: chos yod bzhin chos ma yin pa la 'jug par byed ba ni /
analyzed: chos yod bzhin chos ma yin pa la 'jug par byed ba ni /
translated: While Dharma exists, engaging in non-Dharma

original: dpyod pa @140b med pa can gyi bya ba yin la /
analyzed: dpyod pa @140b med pa can gyi bya ba yin la /
translated: is an activity of one who is not an analysis.

original: de'i bya ba yang de'i 'bras bu ster ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bya ba yang de'i 'bras bu ster ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that activity is the bestowal of its result. This is the meaning.

original: chos ma yin pa nyid ni chos ma yin pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa nyid ni chos ma yin pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it the case that non-Dharma generates the result of non-Dharma?

original: dbang phyug ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that God is the cause of that.

original: des na dpyad pa med pa'i bya ba'i las su ster ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dpyad pa med pa'i bya ba'i las su ster ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the result is not given by an action that is not analyzed.

original: snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: This is what you think.

original: 'on te 'di chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you say that this is non-Dharma,

original: de lta na yang sdig pa dgag par bya ba yin pa na /
analyzed: de lta na yang sdig pa dgag par bya ba yin pa na /
translated: then since it is to be stopped,

original: de'i 'bras bu ster ba ni dpyod pa med pa'i bya ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ster ba ni dpyod pa med pa'i bya ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: it is taught that the result that is given by it is an action that is not analyzed.

original: dbang phyug gzhan ni nus med pas //
analyzed: dbang phyug gzhan ni nus med pas //
translated: Since another God is powerless,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says this.

original: gal te dbang phyug gzhan bzhin du na 'di yang sdig pa dgag pa la nus pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug gzhan bzhin du na 'di yang sdig pa dgag pa la nus pa med pa yin na /
translated: If, like another God, he is powerless to stop sin,

original: de lta na sdig pa dgag pa la bzhin du /
analyzed: de lta na sdig pa dgag pa la bzhin du /
translated: then, just like stopping sin,

original: sdig can rnams la dgos pa byed pa nyid kyi chos dang / de'i 'bras bu byed pa po nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdig can rnams la dgos pa byed pa nyid kyi chos dang / de'i 'bras bu byed pa po nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: he would not be the cause of the result of Dharma, which is the performance of the purpose of sinful people.

original: dbang phyug gi byed pa po ma yin par thob par bstan pa ni /🔽sdig bzhin thams cad dbang phyug gis //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi byed pa po ma yin par thob par bstan pa ni / sdig bzhin thams cad dbang phyug gis //
translated: The teaching that he is not the agent of the powerful is:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Like sin, everything is not from the powerful.”

original: gal te yang sdig pa dang sdig pa dgag pa dang de'i sgo nas chos dang de'i 'bras bu rnams 'byed pa ma yin te lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te yang sdig pa dang sdig pa dgag pa dang de'i sgo nas chos dang de'i 'bras bu rnams 'byed pa ma yin te lta na yang /
translated: If sin and the prohibition of sin and, by that, the differentiation of virtue and its effects were not from the powerful,

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyi byed pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyi byed pa po ma yin te /
translated: then he would not be the agent of all.

original: sdig pa'i 'bras bu byed do snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: sdig pa'i 'bras bu byed do snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If one thinks that the effect of sin is from the powerful,

original: dbang phyug med na 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dbang phyug med na 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then “if the powerful does not exist, the world” is stated.

original: ji ltar de med kyang chos ni rang gi rgyu kho na las skye ba yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar de med kyang chos ni rang gi rgyu kho na las skye ba yin la /
translated: Even though he does not exist, phenomena are born from their own causes alone.

original: de bzhin du de'i 'bras bu yang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i 'bras bu yang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And likewise, their effects are also from their own causes alone.

original: rgyu bzhin du 'bras bu yang des byas pa mi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu bzhin du 'bras bu yang des byas pa mi srid pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for the effect to be made by the powerful, just as the cause is.

original: dpyod pa med pa can gyi bya ba nyid ni dpyod pa can gyi grub pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa can gyi bya ba nyid ni dpyod pa can gyi grub pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the activity of the non-analytical contradicts the establishment of the analytical.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: chos ma yin pa ni chos kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ba la bar du gcod par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa ni chos kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ba la bar du gcod par byed pa yin la /
translated: Non-Dharma is an obstruction to experiencing the result of Dharma.

original: de zad pa'i don du de'i 'bras bu nyams su myong bar byed du 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: de zad pa'i don du de'i 'bras bu nyams su myong bar byed du 'jug pa ni /
translated: For the purpose of eliminating that, one should experience the result of Dharma.

original: bde ba'i don du ma yin nam /
analyzed: bde ba'i don du ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t that for the sake of happiness?

original: de ji ltar dpyod pa med pa'i 'bras bu can nyid yin du sems pa ni /🔽'on te de med par ni 'gal //
analyzed: de ji ltar dpyod pa med pa'i 'bras bu can nyid yin du sems pa ni / 'on te de med par ni 'gal //
translated: How could it be thought that it is a result that is not analyzed?

original: zhes bya ba'o //🔽lan ni / rtogs pa dang ldan ji ltar na //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // lan ni / rtogs pa dang ldan ji ltar na //
translated: If it is not, it is contradictory.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reply is: How could one who has realization

original: des ma byas pa las ni chos ma yin pa'i 'bras bu mi 'byung la /
analyzed: des ma byas pa las ni chos ma yin pa'i 'bras bu mi 'byung la /
translated: From that which is not done, the result of non-Dharma does not arise.

original: chos ma yin pa rnams kyis kyang bar du bcad pas /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa rnams kyis kyang bar du bcad pas /
translated: And since non-Dharma also obstructs,

original: chos kyi 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: the result of Dharma does not arise.

original: 'bras bu gnyi ga med pa ni srog /
analyzed: 'bras bu gnyi ga med pa ni srog /
translated: Therefore, the result of both not existing is liberation.

original: @141a * // chags kyi thar pa nyid skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @141a * // chags kyi thar pa nyid skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since liberation is the primary purpose of a person,

original: dpyod pa yod pa chos ma yin pa'i 'bras bu ster ba po nyid byed pa po ma yin pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dpyod pa yod pa chos ma yin pa'i 'bras bu ster ba po nyid byed pa po ma yin pa nyid ni /
translated: The result of analysis is that the person who is not an agent is the one who gives the result of non-Dharma. The result of being an agent is the one who is not the result of analysis.

original: dpyod pa'i 'bras bu yin la byed pa po nyid ni dpyod pa dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu can yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i 'bras bu yin la byed pa po nyid ni dpyod pa dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu can yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the result of being an agent is the one who is not the result of analysis.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni dpyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni dpyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One who is endowed with understanding is endowed with analysis.

original: rtsed mos byed pa ni dpyod pa yod na 'gal ba'i 'bras bu yin pas mi bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtsed mos byed pa ni dpyod pa yod na 'gal ba'i 'bras bu yin pas mi bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The result of analysis is that play is not to be done, since it is the result of what is contrary to analysis.

original: rtog pa sngon byed ga la yin /
analyzed: rtog pa sngon byed ga la yin /
translated: How can there be prior understanding?

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: tshig ni shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: tshig ni shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it seen that words are preceded by understanding?

original: de'i yang tshig ni me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i yul la shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i yang tshig ni me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i yul la shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And since the object of that, such as fire sacrifice, is preceded by understanding,

original: shes pa'i bye brag dang 'brel pa can nyid du grub pa yin na /
analyzed: shes pa'i bye brag dang 'brel pa can nyid du grub pa yin na /
translated: it is established as being related to a particular understanding.

original: de las bzlog pa gang yin pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa gang yin pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: What is the opposite of that is to be eliminated.

original: chos ma yin pa'i 'bras bu ni rang las sam /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i 'bras bu ni rang las sam /
translated: The result of non-Dharma is suffering.🔽

original: gzhan las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The result of non-Dharma arises from itself or from another.

original: snyam du sems pa la /🔽gal te bstan bcos gzhan pa kun //
analyzed: snyam du sems pa la / gal te bstan bcos gzhan pa kun //
translated: If you think this,🔽then the verse states,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “If all other treatises🔽are connected with each other🔽through the relation of what is to be refuted and what is the refutation,

original: gcig la gcig gcad bya dang gcod byed nyid kyis 'brel pa can dang / byed par nus pa can gyi dngos po nye bar ston pa yin na /
analyzed: gcig la gcig gcad bya dang gcod byed nyid kyis 'brel pa can dang / byed par nus pa can gyi dngos po nye bar ston pa yin na /
translated: and they present things that are capable of performing a function,🔽then this treatise is not connected with any other treatise🔽through the relation of what is to be refuted and what is the refutation,🔽and it does not present things that are capable of performing a function.

original: shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi tshig yin te /
analyzed: shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi tshig yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is like the statement of a madman.

original: 'brel pa can ma yin pa ni ma yin no //🔽tshig 'di ni me'i sbyin sreg gis mtho ris sgrub par byed pa dang / cig shos dag ni 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa can ma yin pa ni ma yin no // tshig 'di ni me'i sbyin sreg gis mtho ris sgrub par byed pa dang / cig shos dag ni 'gal ba yin te /
translated: It is not a treatise.”🔽This statement is contradictory because it is not a subject that can be either rejected or accepted.

original: dor ba dang blang ba'i yul can ma yin pa nyid kyis smyon pa'i tshig bzhin du dpyod pa med pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin gyi /
analyzed: dor ba dang blang ba'i yul can ma yin pa nyid kyis smyon pa'i tshig bzhin du dpyod pa med pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin gyi /
translated: Like the statement of a madman, it is preceded by an analysis that does not exist.

original: dpyod pa la rnam par 'jog byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpyod pa la rnam par 'jog byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not set forth an analysis.

original: stobs mtshungs pa dang 'gal ba yin na rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /🔽chab cu drug pa'i 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa bzhin du ches mtshan mo'i dus su cha bcu drug pa can 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: stobs mtshungs pa dang 'gal ba yin na rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba ma yin nam / chab cu drug pa'i 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa bzhin du ches mtshan mo'i dus su cha bcu drug pa can 'dzin pa'am /
translated: If it is contradictory to something of equal strength, then it is not a valid cognition.🔽Just as the cognition of the sixteen parts at dawn does not apprehend the sixteen parts at midnight,

original: ches mtshan mo cha bcu drug can mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ches mtshan mo cha bcu drug can mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: or the cognition of the sixteen parts at midnight does not apprehend the sixteen parts at dawn.

original: 'di la yang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la yang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: Here too, there is equality.

original: bar chad yod pas bkag pa ni de'i tshe nyid mngon pa la sgrub pa tsam las sgrub par byed par 'gyur zhes go ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bar chad yod pas bkag pa ni de'i tshe nyid mngon pa la sgrub pa tsam las sgrub par byed par 'gyur zhes go ba ma yin te /
translated: When obstructed, the negation is merely established in the present moment, not as an establishing agent.

original: phan tshun 'gal bas tshad ma nyid ma yin pa kho na'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal bas tshad ma nyid ma yin pa kho na'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of mutual contradiction, it is not a valid cognition at all.

original: gzhan du na ma mthong ba'i don gyi tshig tshad ma ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du na ma mthong ba'i don gyi tshig tshad ma ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Otherwise, the statement about an unseen object would not be a valid cognition. This is the meaning.

original: @141b sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos ni gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: @141b sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos ni gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren't the treatises of the Buddhists and others composed by others?

original: des na 'gal ba ma yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: des na 'gal ba ma yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Therefore, because there is no contradiction,

original: mi 'gal ba ni rjes su 'grub par rung bar nye bar ston par byed pa ni dpyod pa dang ldan pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: mi 'gal ba ni rjes su 'grub par rung bar nye bar ston par byed pa ni dpyod pa dang ldan pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: But it is only the one who is endowed with analysis who can demonstrate the suitability of establishing the non-contradictory.

original: 'on te bstan bcos mtha' dag byed pa las ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te bstan bcos mtha' dag byed pa las ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, is it not from the composition of the entire treatise?

original: sa gzhi la sogs pa dang rig byed la sogs pa ni dpyod pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: sa gzhi la sogs pa dang rig byed la sogs pa ni dpyod pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu can yin te /
translated: The ground, etc. and the Vedas, etc. are the causes of the one endowed with analysis,

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa yin te /
translated: because they are effects. This is inconclusive,

original: de rgyu ma yin pa la yang yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de rgyu ma yin pa la yang yod pa'i phyir //
translated: because it exists even in the non-cause.

original: zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is demonstrated by

original: de'i tshe bstan bcos gzhan bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe bstan bcos gzhan bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: just as in the case of another treatise.

original: ma rig pa'i gzhan dbang gi sems pa can gyi 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gzhan dbang gi sems pa can gyi 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the effect of the one whose mind is under the influence of ignorance is seen,

original: de las kyi ngo bo nyid kho nar grub pa yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa grub pa kho na tshad mas grub pa yin pa'i nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: de las kyi ngo bo nyid kho nar grub pa yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa grub pa kho na tshad mas grub pa yin pa'i nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: it is established as the nature of karma itself, not otherwise. The conclusion that the thesis is established by valid cognition alone is summarized by

original: de la skye bo tha mal pa thams cad ces bya ba / ri la sogs pa shin tu chen po thams cad kyi bya ba la bdag cag la sogs pa thams cad kyi bdag byed pa po ma yin nam /🔽de bzhin du byed pa po nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la skye bo tha mal pa thams cad ces bya ba / ri la sogs pa shin tu chen po thams cad kyi bya ba la bdag cag la sogs pa thams cad kyi bdag byed pa po ma yin nam / de bzhin du byed pa po nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, all ordinary people think that the creator of all the great mountains and so forth is not ourselves and so on.🔽In the same way, because they do not see a creator and because they are incapable, they think that the creator of all the various effects is a single God who is not similar to ourselves and so on.

original: 'di'i phyir 'bras bu'i bye brag mthong ba las bdag cag la sogs pa gcig pu dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dbang phyug yin no snyam du sems pa ni /🔽bdag kun byed po min zhe na //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir 'bras bu'i bye brag mthong ba las bdag cag la sogs pa gcig pu dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dbang phyug yin no snyam du sems pa ni / bdag kun byed po min zhe na //
translated: In this regard, the root verse states:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that God is not the creator of all,

original: bden te gcig pu las mtshan nyid mi mthun par go ba na /
analyzed: bden te gcig pu las mtshan nyid mi mthun par go ba na /
translated: That is true. But when you understand that God is not the creator of all,

original: du ma las kyang yin gyi phul du byung ba gcig pu ni ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /🔽de'i thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: du ma las kyang yin gyi phul du byung ba gcig pu ni ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni / de'i thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: you should understand that the creator of the various effects is not a single God but many.

original: de'i ni phul du byung ba'i'o //
analyzed: de'i ni phul du byung ba'i'o //
translated: In this regard, the root verse states:

original: thams cad kyi ni sa gzhi la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi ni sa gzhi la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: The creator of all is not a single God.🔽The creator of all is not a single God.

original: phul du byung ba dang bral ba'i bdag nyid kho na rang gi las kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams kyis mthong ba las thams cad kyi byed par khas len pa yin na /
analyzed: phul du byung ba dang bral ba'i bdag nyid kho na rang gi las kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams kyis mthong ba las thams cad kyi byed par khas len pa yin na /
translated: But if you accept that all things are created by a single creator, then why do you not accept that all things are created by many creators?

original: phul du byung ba dang ldan pa du mar rtogs pa ni skyon cis te ma yin zhes bya'i don to //
analyzed: phul du byung ba dang ldan pa du mar rtogs pa ni skyon cis te ma yin zhes bya'i don to //
translated: What is the point of accepting a creator who is not the creator of all things?

original: ji ltar mthong ba de nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //🔽bdag cag la sogs pa'i bdag rnams rang gi las kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams kyi sa gzhi la sogs pa thams cad byed pa yin par yang 'gyur ba yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba de nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no // bdag cag la sogs pa'i bdag rnams rang gi las kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams kyi sa gzhi la sogs pa thams cad byed pa yin par yang 'gyur ba yin nam /
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the creator is posited as the creator of all things just as he is seen to be the creator of some things.🔽Do you accept that the earth and so on are created by all the selves of us and others who are empowered by their own karma?🔽Do you accept that the earth and so on are created by the selves of all sentient beings who are empowered by their own karma?🔽Do you accept that the earth and so on are created by the selves of all sentient beings who are empowered by their own karma and by the selves of us and others who are empowered by our own karma?

original: srog chags rnams @142a * //🔽la mchog spyin pa la sogs pa'i legs pa ni /
analyzed: srog chags rnams @142a * // la mchog spyin pa la sogs pa'i legs pa ni /
translated: Do you accept that the earth and so on are created by the selves of all sentient beings who are empowered by their own karma, by the selves of us and others who are empowered by our own karma, and by the selves of gods who are empowered by their own karma?🔽Do you accept that the earth and so on are created by the selves of all sentient beings who are empowered by their own karma, by the selves of us and others who are empowered by our own karma, by the selves of gods who are empowered by their own karma, and by the selves of those who are born in the hells who are empowered by their own karma?🔽If you accept that, it is correct to infer that the earth and so on are created by the selves of all sentient beings who are empowered by their own karma.🔽If you accept that, it is correct to infer that the earth and so on are created by the selves of all sentient beings who are empowered by their own karma.

original: dbang phyug gcig pu mnyes pa med na mi 'grub pa'i phyir legs pa'i don du gnyer ba rnams kyis mnyes par bya ba'i don du 'di 'dod par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang phyug gcig pu mnyes pa med na mi 'grub pa'i phyir legs pa'i don du gnyer ba rnams kyis mnyes par bya ba'i don du 'di 'dod par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: If you accept that, it is correct to infer that the earth and so on are created by the selves of all sentient beings who are empowered by their own karma.🔽If you accept that, it is correct to infer that the earth and so on are created by the selves of all sentient beings who are empowered by their own karma.🔽If you accept that, it is correct to infer that the earth and so on are created by the selves of all sentient beings who are empowered by their own karma.🔽If you accept that, it is correct to infer that the earth and so on are created by the selves of all sentient beings who are empowered by their own karma.

original: thams cad kyi byed pa'i don du ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyi byed pa'i don du ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: But it is not for the sake of the activity of all.

original: 'on te gzhan du kun shes nyid //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du kun shes nyid //
translated: Or else, it is the very nature of the other.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de'i 'di lta bu nyid la ni lung tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'di lta bu nyid la ni lung tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is so, then scripture is a valid means of knowledge.

original: ma grub pas ma grub pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pas ma grub pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: But if it is not established, then it is not established that it establishes.🔽Because the functioning and non-functioning are mixed, like samsara, like poison mixed with food, it is said that this is only placed in the category of what is to be rejected.

original: don byed pa dang don mi byed pa 'dres pa'i phyir 'khor ba bzhin dang dug dang zan 'dres pa bzhin du 'di dor ba'i phyogs su bcug pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar lan 'debs pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don byed pa dang don mi byed pa 'dres pa'i phyir 'khor ba bzhin dang dug dang zan 'dres pa bzhin du 'di dor ba'i phyogs su bcug pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar lan 'debs pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The answer is taught:

original: don ni don med byed nus pa //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don ni don med byed nus pa // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning is able to make the meaningless.

original: phan byed pa min phyir ni gnod pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phan byed pa min phyir ni gnod pa byed pa yin no //
translated: Because it does not benefit, it harms.

original: 'di ji srid du legs par sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa nges pa med pa de srid du /
analyzed: 'di ji srid du legs par sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa nges pa med pa de srid du /
translated: As long as this is uncertain, as long as it gives good gifts,

original: bsnyen bkur la sogs pa la 'jug pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur la sogs pa la 'jug pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: it is taught that one does not engage in service and so forth.

original: kun shes nyid du grub pa ni //
analyzed: kun shes nyid du grub pa ni //
translated: The establishment of omniscience

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is not seen in the world.

original: rtogs pa thams cad nyid ni mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa las 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: rtogs pa thams cad nyid ni mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa las 'byung ba yin la /
translated: All realizations arise from following what is seen.

original: de las bzlog pa'i dbang phyug la ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i dbang phyug la ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The opposite of that is taught to be not the case for Īśvara:

original: thams cad shes min byed pa po //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad shes min byed pa po // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The maker is not known by all.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i nus pa mthong ba las yin gyi rtogs pa gzhan ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /🔽rang gi bya ba rdza mkhan sogs //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i nus pa mthong ba las yin gyi rtogs pa gzhan ni ma yin par bstan pa ni / rang gi bya ba rdza mkhan sogs //
translated: The power of potters and so on is seen in pots and so on. It is taught that there is no other realization:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The potter and so on are their own activity.

original: sa gzhi la sogs pa'i las kyi nus pa tsam du rtogs pas don rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sa gzhi la sogs pa'i las kyi nus pa tsam du rtogs pas don rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that the realization of the meaning is not the mere realization of the power of the action of the ground and so on:

original: las kyi nus pas grub 'gyur na //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi nus pas grub 'gyur na // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If established by the power of action,

original: gal te mi shes pa med pa tsam kho nas rdza mkhan la sogs pa 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi shes pa med pa tsam kho nas rdza mkhan la sogs pa 'jug pa yin na /
translated: If the mere absence of noncognizance engages potters and so on,

original: dus thams cad du 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: would they not engage at all times?

original: de lta ni ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: That is not the case. Therefore:

original: 'ga' zhig gis brtsad par bya ba yin par sems pa ni /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis brtsad par bya ba yin par sems pa ni /
translated: Some think that this should be investigated.

original: gal te shes kyang rdza mkhan sogs //
analyzed: gal te shes kyang rdza mkhan sogs //
translated: If he knows, why doesn’t he always create?

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the verse:

original: 'dzud byed du yang dus thams cad du cis mi 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i lan du /🔽khyad par med par dbang phyug kyang //
analyzed: 'dzud byed du yang dus thams cad du cis mi 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i lan du / khyad par med par dbang phyug kyang //
translated: If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /🔽'on te gang gi tshe kho na dbang phyug gi bdag nyid kyi thams cad shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i dbang phyug nyid yin @142b par gzhan rnams kyis go bar 'dod pa de'i tshe /🔽skul bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / 'on te gang gi tshe kho na dbang phyug gi bdag nyid kyi thams cad shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i dbang phyug nyid yin @142b par gzhan rnams kyis go bar 'dod pa de'i tshe / skul bar byed pa yin la /
translated: In response to this, it is said:🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?

original: de med na ni skul byed ma yin pa'i phyir res 'ga' ba'i skul byed yin par rigs pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de med na ni skul byed ma yin pa'i phyir res 'ga' ba'i skul byed yin par rigs pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?

original: 'on te bdag nyid kun shes par //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te bdag nyid kun shes par // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?

original: rdza mkhan la sogs par yang gang gi tshe 'dod pa de'i tshe byed pa yin par cis mi 'gyur ba bstan pa /
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs par yang gang gi tshe 'dod pa de'i tshe byed pa yin par cis mi 'gyur ba bstan pa /
translated: If he is the creator, why doesn’t he always create?🔽If he is the

original: de ni de ltar gang gis shes //
analyzed: de ni de ltar gang gis shes //
translated: How could it be known in that way?

original: zhes bya bas /🔽skyes bu yis ni mchog gzhan ni //
analyzed: zhes bya bas / skyes bu yis ni mchog gzhan ni //
translated: Thus,🔽The supreme person is called

original: dam pa'i bdag nyid ces brjod pa //
analyzed: dam pa'i bdag nyid ces brjod pa //
translated: The nature of the highest.

original: gang gis khams gsum na bzhugs pas //
analyzed: gang gis khams gsum na bzhugs pas //
translated: By him, residing in the three realms,

original: dbang phyug rtogs pas byas pa yin //
analyzed: dbang phyug rtogs pas byas pa yin //
translated: The creator is understood to be God.

original: zhes zer ba bsal ba yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes zer ba bsal ba yin pa'i phyir //
translated: This is stated in order to dispel that.

original: bsdad nas 'jug pa ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bsdad nas 'jug pa ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is uncertain whether it engages after abiding.

original: yang na the tshom za ba yin //
analyzed: yang na the tshom za ba yin //
translated: Or it is doubtful.

original: zhes bstan pa bshad pa ni //🔽bdag nyid brtags nas byed pa gang //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa bshad pa ni // bdag nyid brtags nas byed pa gang //
translated: The explanation of the teaching is:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Whatever is done after examining oneself.

original: bstan bcos kyi don la sogs pa'i yul blo ni ma goms pa'i yul la gzhan dang gzhan sngar ma byung ba'i rgol ba dang / lan gyi rnam pa can bsres pa dang / mi shes pa dang yid la mi 'dod pa rnams kyis rang nyid skyed par byed par nus pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don la sogs pa'i yul blo ni ma goms pa'i yul la gzhan dang gzhan sngar ma byung ba'i rgol ba dang / lan gyi rnam pa can bsres pa dang / mi shes pa dang yid la mi 'dod pa rnams kyis rang nyid skyed par byed par nus pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The mind that is the object of the treatise and so on is not able to be produced by itself through objects that are not familiar, through arguments that have not occurred before, through mixing replies, and through ignorance and mental dislike.

original: gzhan gyi bskyed bya nyid yin no zer ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bskyed bya nyid yin no zer ba ni /
translated: It is said to be the product of others.

original: kun gyi blo nyid dbang phyug las //
analyzed: kun gyi blo nyid dbang phyug las //
translated: The mind of all is from God.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is meant.🔽The appearance of the previously non-existent argument and response endowed with familiarity is due to the force of familiarity with the convention of the previous elders.

original: goms pa dang ldan pa'i sngar ma byung ba'i rgol ba dang lan du snang ba ni snga ma snga ma'i rgan po'i tha snyad la goms pa yin pa'i shugs kyis dbang phyug rgyu mtshan yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: goms pa dang ldan pa'i sngar ma byung ba'i rgol ba dang lan du snang ba ni snga ma snga ma'i rgan po'i tha snyad la goms pa yin pa'i shugs kyis dbang phyug rgyu mtshan yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that God is not the reason.

original: de de ltar sa gzhi la sogs pa ni sems pa dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin par bsgrubs pa la /
analyzed: de de ltar sa gzhi la sogs pa ni sems pa dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin par bsgrubs pa la /
translated: In that way, having established that the earth and so on are not the effects of conscious beings,

original: grangs can gyis dmigs nas dpe de nyid kyis bum pa la sogs pa la yang yin par bsgrub par 'dod pas zer ba ni /
analyzed: grangs can gyis dmigs nas dpe de nyid kyis bum pa la sogs pa la yang yin par bsgrub par 'dod pas zer ba ni /
translated: the Sāṃkhya, observing that, wishes to establish that a pot and so on are also like that example.

original: shing sogs rnams kyi dbyibs sems pa'i //
analyzed: shing sogs rnams kyi dbyibs sems pa'i //
translated: The shape of trees and so on is the result of consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: bum pa la sogs pa yang 'ji ba'i gong bu la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yang 'ji ba'i gong bu la sogs pa la /
translated: A pot and so on is also a lump of clay and so on.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la phra ba'i gnas skabs kyis bcug pa nyid kho na mngon par byung ba yin te ji ltar shing ni shing gis bcug pa'i sa bon las yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la phra ba'i gnas skabs kyis bcug pa nyid kho na mngon par byung ba yin te ji ltar shing ni shing gis bcug pa'i sa bon las yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: A pot and so on is produced from the subtle state of the seed alone, just as a tree is produced from a seed planted by a tree.

original: shing gis bcug pa nyid kyang gzhan dag gi ni shing gzhan las ni sa bon yin la /
analyzed: shing gis bcug pa nyid kyang gzhan dag gi ni shing gzhan las ni sa bon yin la /
translated: The seed of another tree is planted by another tree.

original: sa bon @143a * //
analyzed: sa bon @143a * //
translated: The seed is planted by the tree.

original: las kyang shing gzhan zhes bya ba'i bsam pas yin la grangs can rnams kyis sa bon la gnas pa'i shing phra mo las yin zhing phra ba'i ngo bo de nyid gtso bo yin zhes zer la /
analyzed: las kyang shing gzhan zhes bya ba'i bsam pas yin la grangs can rnams kyis sa bon la gnas pa'i shing phra mo las yin zhing phra ba'i ngo bo de nyid gtso bo yin zhes zer la /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say that the tree is produced from the subtle seed that exists in the seed and that subtle nature is the primal substance.

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa ni gar mkhan gar la sbyor ba la 'khor 'dus pa bzhin du /
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa ni gar mkhan gar la sbyor ba la 'khor 'dus pa bzhin du /
translated: Potters and so on are like dancers who are surrounded by an audience.

original: dpang po yin gyi 'di 'di'i ngo bos byed pa po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dpang po yin gyi 'di 'di'i ngo bos byed pa po ni ma yin te /
translated: They are witnesses, but they are not agents by the nature of that.

original: 'ji ba'i gong bu las gzhan pa yang skyed byed du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'ji ba'i gong bu las gzhan pa yang skyed byed du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it would follow that something other than the lump of clay would be the producer.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa las 'byung ba la nges pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa las 'byung ba la nges pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no certainty in the occurrence of the desire of a person.

original: sa bon gyi rgyu'i shing las sa bon yin la /
analyzed: sa bon gyi rgyu'i shing las sa bon yin la /
translated: From a tree that has a seed as its cause, a seed is produced,

original: de'i 'bras bu shing gi dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa so sor nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu shing gi dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa so sor nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and its result, the shape, color, etc. of the tree, are individually ascertained.

original: sa bon gyi rgyu'i shing ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sa bon gyi rgyu'i shing ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, “A tree that has a seed as its cause . . . ”

original: snang bzhin pa'i sa bon la sogs pa la ni rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: snang bzhin pa'i sa bon la sogs pa la ni rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Don’t seeds, etc. that are actually appearing have a cause?

original: rgyu la yod pa des ji ltar dgos snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: rgyu la yod pa des ji ltar dgos snyam du sems pa la /
translated: What is the need for that which exists in the cause?

original: dbang phyug kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dbang phyug kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, “Nor is it God . . . ”

original: gal te sa bon la sogs pas sam gzhan gyis kyang med par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te sa bon la sogs pas sam gzhan gyis kyang med par byed pa yin na /
translated: If seeds, etc. are made to not exist by another,

original: sa bon gzhan las cis mi byed /
analyzed: sa bon gzhan las cis mi byed /
translated: why does it not make seeds from another?

original: mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not able to.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid nus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid nus pa yin no //
translated: The nature of the result is able to.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not another.

original: gzhan las ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes mtshungs par rjes su skyar ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan las ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes mtshungs par rjes su skyar ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is similar to the question, “Why does it not arise from another?”

original: mar mes gsal ba ni snga na med par bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: mar mes gsal ba ni snga na med par bya ba ma yin /
translated: The light of a lamp is not something that was not previously existent that is made existent.

original: de bzhin du rdza mkhan gyis yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdza mkhan gyis yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, it is not the case that a potter and so on is the agent.

original: ji ltar nus pa med pa yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar nus pa med pa yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: How is it that they are not agents?

original: des na rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i skyes bu zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: des na rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i skyes bu zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “A potter and so on is called an agent.”

original: re zhig gsal ba ni dngos po las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gsal ba ni dngos po las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: First, a manifest thing is not different from a thing,

original: snga ma bzhin du bye brag med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bye brag med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, as before, it would absurdly follow that there would be no distinction.

original: tha dad pa ma yin na yang ci yang ma byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin na yang ci yang ma byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not different, then it would not do anything at all.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dag gcig pa nyid du shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma dag gcig pa nyid du shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is known that the former and latter are the same,

original: gzhan du byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan du byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: it is not the case that it does something else.

original: de dang gzhan gcig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang gzhan gcig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is the same as that and different,

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is contradictory.

original: de'i phyir gtso bo kho na chu bzhin du rlabs dang / cig shos nyid kyi 'bras bu dang cig shos nyid du gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtso bo kho na chu bzhin du rlabs dang / cig shos nyid kyi 'bras bu dang cig shos nyid du gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the principal alone is like water and waves, and the effect of the other alone is the other alone.

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a potter, etc.

original: gtso bo kho na'i rgal ba dang 'bying ba yin pas 'bras bu skye ba dang 'jig pa dag yin zhes ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: gtso bo kho na'i rgal ba dang 'bying ba yin pas 'bras bu skye ba dang 'jig pa dag yin zhes ston par byed pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the principal alone is the rising and sinking, and that the arising and destruction of the effect are due to that, he says:

original: skyes @143b bu'i nye bar longs spyod pa zhes bya ba ste /🔽gang gi phyir rgal ba dang bying pa yin na /
analyzed: skyes @143b bu'i nye bar longs spyod pa zhes bya ba ste / gang gi phyir rgal ba dang bying pa yin na /
translated: The enjoyment of the born.🔽Because of the rising and sinking, there is arising and destruction.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag yin la de'i phyir yang sems pa can dang cig shos kyi rgyu'i nus pa nyid med par nye bar sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag yin la de'i phyir yang sems pa can dang cig shos kyi rgyu'i nus pa nyid med par nye bar sdud pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the power of the cause of the sentient and the other is not withdrawn.

original: des na blo dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na blo dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is intelligent.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas gtso bor mngon par gsal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas gtso bor mngon par gsal ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t the manifestation of the principal due to the desire of the person?

original: 'dod pa yang mthong ba'i yul la yin zhing mthong ba yang 'ji ba'i gong bu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su gsal ba ma yin na bdag cag la sogs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang mthong ba'i yul la yin zhing mthong ba yang 'ji ba'i gong bu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su gsal ba ma yin na bdag cag la sogs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Also, desire is for an object that is seen, and seeing is not clear when the object is in a state such as a lump of clay.

original: mthong bar byed pa po'i dbang po las 'das pa mthong ba po 'ga' zhig thob pa po nyid ni 'di la yang yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: mthong bar byed pa po'i dbang po las 'das pa mthong ba po 'ga' zhig thob pa po nyid ni 'di la yang yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Therefore, some unseen seer who is the agent of seeing is the experiencer.

original: 'on te skyes bu so so ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te skyes bu so so ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But if you think that each individual person

original: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin 'dod pas dbang phyug rgyu yin par grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin 'dod pas dbang phyug rgyu yin par grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is the experiencer, then it is established that God is the cause because you assert the nature of the effect.

original: nus pa can gyi tshogs pa las rjes su dpog pa yin na /
analyzed: nus pa can gyi tshogs pa las rjes su dpog pa yin na /
translated: If you infer that God exists from the collection of things that have the potential to produce the effect,

original: 'dod pa 'byung ba yin par smra ba ni 'di la bshad zin to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa 'byung ba yin par smra ba ni 'di la bshad zin to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: we have already explained that it is desire that arises.

original: de'i 'dod pa yang gtso bo ni sems pa can ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa yang gtso bo ni sems pa can ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: And is not the desire of God not an intelligent principle?

original: mi shes pa nyid ni mi 'jug pa'i phyir la sems pa can ni 'jug par byed pa yin no snyam du sems pas zer ba ni /🔽mi shes phyir ni 'o ma ni //
analyzed: mi shes pa nyid ni mi 'jug pa'i phyir la sems pa can ni 'jug par byed pa yin no snyam du sems pas zer ba ni / mi shes phyir ni 'o ma ni //
translated: Since non-understanding does not engage, and since the conscious being engages, it is thought that the conscious being is the agent.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But milk does not flow because of non-understanding.

original: sems pa can ma yin pa 'dug par mthong ba yin na gzhan 'jug par byed pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems pa can ma yin pa 'dug par mthong ba yin na gzhan 'jug par byed pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: If one sees a non-conscious being, such as milk, sitting, it is not the agent of flowing.

original: ji lta ba mthong ba de nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ji lta ba ma mthong ba la yang ches thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji lta ba mthong ba de nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ji lta ba ma mthong ba la yang ches thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one sees it as it is, one remains in that state, and if one does not see it as it is, the consequence is even greater.

original: de ltar na 'di tsam gyi nus par byed pa la sogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di tsam gyi nus par byed pa la sogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the capacity of the agent and so on,

original: da ni gong bu rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa yin par brjod pa ni bum pa dang kham phor la sogs pa rnams ni 'ji ba'i rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gong bu rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa yin par brjod pa ni bum pa dang kham phor la sogs pa rnams ni 'ji ba'i rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: now it is said that the following of the aggregates is explained. Since pots, dishes, and so on are seen to follow clay,

original: 'ji ba'i ngo bo ni rgyun yin la /
analyzed: 'ji ba'i ngo bo ni rgyun yin la /
translated: the nature of clay is a continuum.

original: de bzhin du 'ji ba dang chu la sogs pa rnams kyang rjes kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir de'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'ji ba dang chu la sogs pa rnams kyang rjes kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir de'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: Likewise, clay, water, and so on are the nature of the pot because they exist in a subsequent state.

original: de las kyang de'i ngo bor rtogs na mthar bde ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las kyang de'i ngo bor rtogs na mthar bde ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: And if it is understood that the pot is the nature of those, then in the end, it is seen to be the nature of pleasure and so on.

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi gtso bo'i ming can du gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pas zer ba ni de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi gtso bo'i ming can du gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pas zer ba ni de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the intention is that it is the nature of pleasure and so on, and it is the primary nature that is called “Īśvara.”

original: mthar bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthar bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “in the end, pleasure and so on” is stated for that reason.

original: gtso bo dang dbang phyug kyang ci'i phyir ma yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gtso bo dang dbang phyug kyang ci'i phyir ma yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If you think, “Why not call it ‘primary nature’ or ‘Īśvara’?”

original: @144a * // gnyi ga bsdus pa la gnod pa can bstan pa ni /
analyzed: @144a * // gnyi ga bsdus pa la gnod pa can bstan pa ni /
translated: The following is stated to show the fault of including both:

original: don rnams rtogs pa sngon 'gro can /🔽zhes bya ba ste /🔽sems pa med pa'i bskyed bya /
analyzed: don rnams rtogs pa sngon 'gro can / zhes bya ba ste / sems pa med pa'i bskyed bya /
translated: The realization of objects is preceded by a cause.

original: sa gzhi la sogs pa 'bras bu'i ngo bo dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa gzhi la sogs pa 'bras bu'i ngo bo dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the result, such as the earth element, is observed to be the nature of that which is produced, which is not a mind.

original: sems pa can gyi bskyed bya khyim la sogs pa'i ngo bo la de las gzhan pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yod pa nyid ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: sems pa can gyi bskyed bya khyim la sogs pa'i ngo bo la de las gzhan pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yod pa nyid ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
translated: One might think, But in the case of the entities that are produced by sentient beings, such as a house, etc., there is the existence of something that is different from that, something that is not of the same nature,

original: don rnams rgyu ni rtogs pa dang // mi ldan pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don rnams rgyu ni rtogs pa dang // mi ldan pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and so it is said, The cause of entities is not perceived to be different from them.

original: sa gzhi dang bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i gzugs nyid du bye brag med do zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: sa gzhi dang bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i gzugs nyid du bye brag med do zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that the nature of the earth, pot, etc. is not different in terms of form.

original: / sems pa can ma yin pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo mthong ba las /
analyzed: / sems pa can ma yin pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo mthong ba las /
translated: One might think, But in the case of the nature of the effect that is not sentient,

original: sems pa can ma yin pa rgyu gang yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sems pa can ma yin pa rgyu gang yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: is there not a cause that is not sentient?

original: gtso bo 'am cig shos zhes ci las nges pa yin snyam du sems pas zer ba la /
analyzed: gtso bo 'am cig shos zhes ci las nges pa yin snyam du sems pas zer ba la /
translated: One might think, But how is it ascertained that it is the primal substance or something else?

original: de lta na gtso bo nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta na gtso bo nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, In that case, it is the primal substance itself.

original: 'bras bu'i rjes su 'gro ba las yin par rtogs pa ni de'i ngo bo gtso bo kho nar 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rjes su 'gro ba las yin par rtogs pa ni de'i ngo bo gtso bo kho nar 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is ascertained to be the cause from the conformity with the effect, and so the nature of that is only the primal substance, and not something else.

original: gal te khyim dang bum pa la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams dang / sa gzhi dang chu po la sogs pa rnams kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang gti mug rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te khyim dang bum pa la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams dang / sa gzhi dang chu po la sogs pa rnams kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang gti mug rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: If the specific things such as houses and pots, and the earth, water, etc., are seen to follow after pleasure, pain, and delusion,

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi rgyu yin na /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi rgyu yin na /
translated: then they are causes that have the nature of those.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang skyes bu rnams kyang dngos po nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin yang /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang skyes bu rnams kyang dngos po nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin yang /
translated: But although pleasure, etc., and persons are seen to follow after things,

original: de'i ngo bo rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: they are not causes that have the nature of things.

original: rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba ma nges pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba ma nges pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: To show that seeing their following is inconclusive, he says:

original: dngos po nyid phyir bde sogs dang // zhes bya ba ste /🔽de nyid ni dngos po nyid dam /
analyzed: dngos po nyid phyir bde sogs dang // zhes bya ba ste / de nyid ni dngos po nyid dam /
translated: Because they are things, pleasure, etc.,🔽are like the mind.🔽That itself is the nature of things,

original: sems pa can nyid do //
analyzed: sems pa can nyid do //
translated: or the nature of having a mind.

original: gang yang bye ba dang rdo ba la sogs sa la bum pa dang dbyibs la sog pa med po dang / mi skye ba ni 'jig ba'i gong bu la yod pa dang / skye bar go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gang yang bye ba dang rdo ba la sogs sa la bum pa dang dbyibs la sog pa med po dang / mi skye ba ni 'jig ba'i gong bu la yod pa dang / skye bar go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: Non-arising exists in the entity of destruction, and it is understood that it is produced.

original: de yang yod pa dang skye ba dag gi rjes su 'gro pa med na /
analyzed: de yang yod pa dang skye ba dag gi rjes su 'gro pa med na /
translated: Moreover, if existence and production are not concomitant,🔽it is not the case that they do not exist because of non-existence.

original: yod pa med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes bzlog pa nges pa med pa'i phyir mi rigs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes bzlog pa nges pa med pa'i phyir mi rigs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that it is illogical to say that the reverse is certain is as follows:

original: yang dag par na gtso bo la dbyibs dang mdog sogs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par na gtso bo la dbyibs dang mdog sogs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In reality, shape, color, etc. are called the primary nature.

original: bye ma la sogs pa la ni rgyu med pas 'bras bu mi 'byung ba yin gyi 'bras bu med pa las @144b ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bye ma la sogs pa la ni rgyu med pas 'bras bu mi 'byung ba yin gyi 'bras bu med pa las @144b ni ma yin te /
translated: Since sand, etc. are without cause, the effect does not arise, but it is not that the effect does not exist.

original: khyed kyi 'dod pa ltar na gtso bo'i bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khyed kyi 'dod pa ltar na gtso bo'i bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because, according to your assertion, the effect of the primary nature exists.🔽The demonstration that it is illogical to say that the reverse is certain is as follows:

original: ji ltar gtso bo kha dog la sogs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gtso bo kha dog la sogs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the primary nature is called the effect of color, etc.

original: gtso bo yang bya ba re re zhing tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: gtso bo yang bya ba re re zhing tha dad pa yin la /
translated: The principal is also different for each action.

original: bye ma la ni 'ji ba la sogs pa lta bu yod pa ma yin pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /🔽ji ste nus pa'i rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: bye ma la ni 'ji ba la sogs pa lta bu yod pa ma yin pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni / ji ste nus pa'i rang bzhin gyis //
translated: But isn’t it the case that sand does not exist in the nature of clay and so on?🔽If it is asked, “How is that?”

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said, “If it is by the nature of potential . . .”

original: der ni zhes bya ba la yang de la mthong ba'i 'jig ba la sogs pa'i nus pa yod na bsal ba yin la /
analyzed: der ni zhes bya ba la yang de la mthong ba'i 'jig ba la sogs pa'i nus pa yod na bsal ba yin la /
translated: “There” means that if the potential for destruction and so on is seen there, it is eliminated.

original: ma mthong ba'i rtogs pa la ni tshad ma yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /🔽gzhan bzhin mthong med de la ni //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i rtogs pa la ni tshad ma yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni / gzhan bzhin mthong med de la ni //
translated: If the potential is not seen, it is taught that there is no valid knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If it is not seen, it is like another . . .”

original: bden te gang gi tshe 'jig ba gong bu kho na las bum pa yin pa de'i tshe gtso bo ma yin la /
analyzed: bden te gang gi tshe 'jig ba gong bu kho na las bum pa yin pa de'i tshe gtso bo ma yin la /
translated: It is true that when destruction is a pot that is only a collection, it is not the principal.

original: gang gi tshe yang 'jig ba la sogs pa rgyu min pa de las kyang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang 'jig ba la sogs pa rgyu min pa de las kyang /
translated: But when destruction and so on are not causes, even from that,

original: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtogs pa yin na /
translated: it is the realization that “its cause . . .” and so on.

original: mtha'i rgyu gcig pu gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: mtha'i rgyu gcig pu gnas pa yin la /
translated: The ultimate cause is the one that abides.

original: gang las 'di spros pa de gtso bo yin par brjod de /
analyzed: gang las 'di spros pa de gtso bo yin par brjod de /
translated: That from which this emanates is called the principal.

original: de yod par mthong ba yin na ji ltar ma mthong bar 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba la skyon med do snyam du sems pa la //
analyzed: de yod par mthong ba yin na ji ltar ma mthong bar 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba la skyon med do snyam du sems pa la //
translated: There is no error.

original: 'bras bu 'bras bu gzhan las te //🔽zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'bras bu gzhan las te //🔽zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: But if the effect arises from another effect,🔽then the effect would be without a cause.
